name: Sapporo Snow Festival (Sapporo Yuki Matsuri)
short_description: Japan's most famous winter festival featuring massive snow and ice sculptures.
description: Held annually in February, this is one of Japan's largest winter events. Spectacular snow statues stretch for 1.5km along Odori Park. Pros: World-class sculptures and food stalls. Cons: Extremely crowded and accommodation prices skyrocket. Cost: Free (amenities extra).

name: Goryokaku Park Cherry Blossoms
short_description: Star-shaped fortress surrounded by over 1,600 cherry trees.
description: A historic star fort that turns pink in spring. It is one of Hokkaido's top hanami spots. Pros: Unique star shape visible from the nearby tower. Cons: Very crowded during peak bloom. Cost: Park is free (Tower: ~1000 JPY).

name: Matsumae Park Cherry Blossom Festival
short_description: Home to 10,000 cherry trees and the only Japanese-style castle in Hokkaido.
description: This park boasts 250 varieties of cherry trees that bloom at different times, allowing for a month-long viewing season. Pros: Long blooming window and historical castle backdrop. Cons: Difficult to access (far from major train lines). Cost: Free.

name: Farm Tomita Lavender Fields
short_description: Iconic lavender fields with rainbow-colored flower rows.
description: The most famous flower farm in Hokkaido. The 'Traditional Lavender Field' is a must-see. Pros: Stunning photography and free entry. Cons: Traffic jams are common in July; trains are infrequent. Cost: Free.

name: Daisetsuzan National Park (Autumn Foliage)
short_description: The earliest autumn colors in Japan, starting in September.
description: Hiking trails around Mount Asahi offer spectacular reds and oranges long before the rest of Japan. Pros: Breathtaking alpine scenery. Cons: Weather is unpredictable; requires hiking gear. Cost: Free (Ropeway: ~3200 JPY).

name: Otaru Snow Light Path
short_description: A romantic winter festival with candles floating in the canal.
description: The town is decorated with snow candles and floating glass lanterns along the canal. Pros: Magical, romantic atmosphere; less commercial than Sapporo. Cons: Very cold near the water; slippery paths. Cost: Free.

name: Hokuryu Sunflower Village
short_description: Japan's largest sunflower field with over 2 million blooms.
description: Vast fields of yellow sunflowers as far as the eye can see. Visitors can rent bicycles or take a tractor bus. Pros: Incredible scale; great for families. Cons: Best reached by car; limited public transit. Cost: Free.

name: Lake Shikotsu Ice Festival
short_description: Ice sculptures created from lake water, illuminated in multi-colored lights.
description: The ice here is famous for its 'Shikotsu Blue' color. Sculptures are created by spraying lake water that freezes in layers. Pros: Magical at night; close to New Chitose Airport. Cons: Extremely cold; entrance fee required. Cost: ~500-1000 JPY.

name: Yosakoi Soran Festival
short_description: High-energy dance festival taking over the streets of Sapporo.
description: Teams from across Japan perform energetic dances using 'naruko' clappers, mixing traditional tunes with modern rhythms. Pros: Vibrant energy and free street performances. Cons: Loud crowds; paid seating sells out fast. Cost: Free (Paid seats available).

name: Sounkyo Ice Fall Festival
short_description: Ice structures built along the Ishikari River in a dramatic gorge.
description: Features ice tunnels, shrines, and slides illuminated at night. Pros: Unique location in a gorge; fireworks on weekends. Cons: Bitterly cold wind; stairs can be icy. Cost: ~500 JPY.

name: Jozankei Onsen (Autumn Foliage)
short_description: Famous hot spring town surrounded by colorful autumn valley walls.
description: Located just an hour from Sapporo, the valley turns vibrant red and yellow in October. Pros: Easy access from Sapporo; combination of views and hot springs. Cons: Traffic jams on Route 230 during peak weekends. Cost: Free (Onsen fees vary).

name: Higashimokoto Shibazakura Park
short_description: A hillside covered in vivid pink moss phlox (shibazakura).
description: The entire hillside turns shocking pink. There is even a pink torii gate. Pros: Surreal landscape; go-karts available. Cons: Remote location in Eastern Hokkaido; requires car/bus. Cost: ~500 JPY.

name: Hakodate Christmas Fantasy
short_description: A giant Christmas tree floats in the bay near the Red Brick Warehouses.
description: A massive fir tree (often gifted from Canada) is illuminated daily, accompanied by soup bars. Pros: Very festive; excellent seafood nearby. Cons: Coastal winds are freezing. Cost: Free.

name: Abashiri Drift Ice Sightseeing
short_description: Icebreaker cruises through the frozen Sea of Okhotsk.
description: Take the 'Aurora' ship to crunch through drift ice that floats down from Russia. Pros: Once-in-a-lifetime experience; chance to see seals/eagles. Cons: Ice conditions are weather-dependent and not guaranteed. Cost: ~4000 JPY.

name: Asahiyama Zoo Penguin Walk
short_description: King penguins parade through the zoo to exercise in winter.
description: To keep penguins fit during winter, they walk along a snowy path right in front of visitors. Pros: Extremely cute; close-up photo ops. Cons: Crowded; only happens twice a day. Cost: ~1000 JPY.

name: Sapporo Autumn Fest
short_description: A massive food festival showcasing Hokkaido's harvest.
description: Held in Odori Park, this event gathers gourmet food, ramen, beer, and wine from all over Hokkaido. Pros: One-stop shop for Hokkaido cuisine; friendly vibe. Cons: Prices can add up; seating is competitive. Cost: Free entry (Food varies).

name: Noboribetsu Hell Valley Demon Fireworks
short_description: Hand-held fireworks performed by 'demons' in Hell Valley.
description: Performers dressed as Yukijin (demons) launch handheld fireworks to pray for good health. Pros: Dramatic setting; unique cultural performance. Cons: Canceled if rainy; restricted to specific nights. Cost: Free.

name: Shirogane Blue Pond Illumination
short_description: The famous blue pond is lit up with ethereal lights in winter.
description: Different lighting patterns illuminate the withered larch trees and frozen pond surface. Pros: Mystical atmosphere different from daytime. Cons: Very dark/cold walking paths; public transit is limited at night. Cost: Free.

name: Hokkaido Shrine Festival
short_description: Sapporo's main summer festival with traditional parades and food stalls.
description: Also known as the Sapporo Festival. Features a Heian-period costume parade and hundreds of food stalls in Nakajima Park. Pros: Great mix of history and festival food fun. Cons: Nakajima Park gets extremely crowded. Cost: Free.

name: Shizunai Nijukken Road Cherry Blossoms
short_description: A 7km straight road lined with over 3,000 cherry trees.
description: Ranked as one of Japan's top 100 cherry blossom spots and roads. The scale is immense. Pros: Epic driving/walking route. Cons: Very far from Sapporo (2.5 hrs); heavy traffic. Cost: Free.

name: Lake Akan Ice Festival (Fuyu-Hana-Bi)
short_description: Fireworks launched over the frozen lake every night.
description: Features ice cutting ceremonies and daily fireworks on the frozen lake surface. Pros: Daily fireworks (rare in winter); Ainu culture nearby. Cons: Remote location. Cost: Free.

name: Otonofuke Tokachigawa Swan Festival
short_description: Light and sound show celebrating the arrival of migratory swans.
description: Sairinka is a nightly event with music and hundreds of synchronized colorful lights in the snow. Pros: Beautifully synchronized light show; warm hand baths available. Cons: Outdoor event in freezing temps. Cost: Free.

name: Moerenuma Park Cherry Blossoms
short_description: Art meets nature in this park designed by Isamu Noguchi.
description: A massive park with geometric glass pyramids and a 'Forest of Cherry Trees' area. Pros: Unique artistic landscape; great for cycling. Cons: Requires a bus ride from the subway; wide open spaces can be windy. Cost: Free.

name: Monbetsu Drift Ice Festival
short_description: Ice sculptures and fresh seafood on the northern coast.
description: A festival celebrating the drift ice season. The main draw is the massive ice sculptures and local crab soup. Pros: Authentic local vibe; famous for crab. Cons: Hard to reach without a car/tour. Cost: Free.

name: Kosetsu-en (Miharashi Park) Autumn Foliage
short_description: Hokkaido's only designated national cultural property garden.
description: A Japanese-style landscape garden that is illuminated at night during peak autumn colors. Pros: Elegant, peaceful atmosphere; stunning night illumination. Cons: slightly outside the main Hakodate city center. Cost: Free.
